title: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, June 18, 2012
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, June 18, 2012
byline: Stuart Cohen, Jeremy Hobson, Bob Moon, John Dimsdale, Jeff Horwich, Heidi N. Moore, Queena Kim, Sam Beard, Christian Fraser, Mary Dooe and Julia Coronado
description: After weeks of uncertainty, it appears as though Greece will be staying in the eurozone... at least for now: the pro-bailout, pro-austerity New Democracy party narrowly beat the anti-bailout Syriza party in yesterday's elections. Critics say President Obama's decision to allow undocumented immigrants to work legally will make the job market here in the U.S. even tougher. Look out for sunburns today, as some new federal rules for sunscreen products that were supposed to take effect won't actually be enforced until December. And what Microsoft is up against when it finally releases its new tablet.
